fields.infoText: Payment is expected within 30 days of submitting this disclosure, unless an exception is made. If the full sum is not paid by that day, daily interest will accrue on the unpaid balance at the rate which applies for Section 86 Taxes Management Act 1970, which varies from time to time.

If the company is struggling and cannot afford the amount due, you maybe be eligible to pay in instalments. 

If eligible you may be granted extra time to repay tax arrears, usually over a period of three to six months.
Interest will continue to accrue during any extra time that may be granted.

Note that interest will continue to accrue both while this is assessed, and during any extra time to pay that may be granted.

You must now make an offer of the amount you are going to pay HMRC. Based on the figures you have provided, this total amount due is ${totalAmountToDeclare.sum}. If the person assessing your disclosure considers this incorrect, they will contact you.

The taxes, duties, National Insurance contributions and other liabilities on the statements attached are unpaid, wholly or in part, because of my failure to meet all my obligations under the relevant acts and regulations. fields.infoText:
We have sent a confirmation email to **${email}** with your submission reference number. It does not include a copy of your answers. [Print or save a PDF copy of your form](${link.printAcknowledgementPdf}) ## What happens next You must pay by ${TODAY +30d}. We’ll send you a payment reference number and details of how to pay. This should arrive by ${TODAY +26d}:
  • ${deliveryMethodText}
  • if it has not arrived by ${TODAY +28d}, contact us on 03000 552294
If your payment arrives after ${TODAY +30d}, daily interest will be added. We will then review your disclosure. If we accept it, we’ll send you a letter of acceptance. If we cannot accept it, we will contact you.
